member.name: T:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ControllerHelper
member.summary: Helper class shared between .Core and .Full implementations.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ControllerHelper.DeserializeReportItemModel(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Deserializes a JSON-serialized model that contains a report definition and an Item string. The Item string can be an expression to be evaluated, or an item name to be rendered.
member.param: Readable stream from the current Request.Body.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ControllerHelper.DeserializedReportItemModel
member.summary: Model containing the deserialized Report instance.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportItemData
member.summary: Model that contains a JSON-serialized report definition and an item identifier for Web Report Designer operations. Used by the Web Report Designer service to pass report data along with specific item references for rendering, processing, and manipulation operations.
member.remarks: This model is commonly used in endpoints that need both the complete report context and a specific item reference, such as live preview rendering and item-specific operations. The Item property can contain various types of identifiers depending on the operation context.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportItemData.Report
member.summary: Gets or sets the JSON-serialized report definition containing the complete report structure and configuration.
member.remarks: The report definition is serialized as JSON to enable efficient transmission between the Web Report Designer client and service.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportItemData.Item
member.summary: Gets or sets the item identifier string that can represent an expression, item name, or other contextual reference.
member.remarks: The interpretation of this property depends on the specific Web Report Designer operation being performed. Common uses include targeting specific report items for rendering or specifying expressions for evaluation.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportItemDefinitionData
member.summary: Model that contains a JSON-serialized report item definition and an item name for Web Report Designer component operations. Used by the Web Report Designer service to pass individual report item data along with identification information for component-specific operations.
member.remarks: This model is commonly used in endpoints that operate on individual report components, such as binding path analysis and component property operations.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportItemDefinitionData.Item
member.summary: Gets or sets the JSON-serialized report item definition containing the component structure and properties.
member.remarks: The report item definition is serialized as JSON to enable efficient transmission of component data between the Web Report Designer client and service.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportItemDefinitionData.ItemName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the report item for identification and targeting within the report structure.
member.remarks: Used to locate and identify specific report items within the report structure for operations such as binding path analysis and property manipulation. The item name must be unique within the scope of its containing report or report section.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase
member.summary: Abstract base API controller that provides REST endpoints for the Telerik Web Report Designer service in ASP.NET Core applications. Handles report design operations, metadata queries, and resource management for the designer client interface.
member.remarks: This class must be inherited to create a functional report designer controller. Configure the service using dependency injection or static configuration objects. Ensure both IReportDesignerServiceConfiguration and IReportServiceConfiguration are properly set up for the controller to function correctly with the Web Report Designer client.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.#ctor(Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.IReportDesignerServiceConfiguration,Telerik.Reporting.Services.IReportServiceConfiguration)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the required service configurations. This constructor sets up the report designer and reporting service configurations needed for the controller to function.
member.param: Provide an object implementing the in order to configure the service.
Provide an object implementing the in order to configure the service.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.ReportDesignerServiceConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration of the web report designer service.
member.remarks: When inheriting the ReportDesignerControllerBase controller basic configuration is needed. Provide an object implementing the in order to configure the service. This should be done in the controllers' constructor using static object to preserve the configuration between requests or using dependency injection.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.DefinitionStorage
member.summary: Gets the definition storage instance for managing report definitions. Provides access to report file operations including loading, saving, and listing available reports.
member.remarks: This property implements lazy initialization and validates the configuration on first access. The storage is retrieved from the reportDesignerServiceConfiguration.DefinitionStorage property and cached for subsequent use.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.SharedDataSourceDefinitionStorage
member.summary: Gets the shared data source storage instance for managing SharedDataSource definitions. Automatically creates a FileSharedDataSourceStorage in the DefinitionStorage base directory if not configured.
member.remarks: This property implements lazy initialization and validates the configuration on first access. If no SharedDataSourceStorage is configured, it creates a default FileSharedDataSourceStorage using the DefinitionStorage base directory and calls Initialize() if the storage is a FileSharedDataSourceStorage instance.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.ResourceStorage
member.summary: Gets the resource storage instance for managing report resources such as images and other assets. Automatically creates a ResourceStorage in the DefinitionStorage base directory if not configured.
member.remarks: This property implements lazy initialization and validates the configuration on first access. If no ResourceStorage is configured, it creates a default ResourceStorage using a subfolder within the DefinitionStorage base directory and calls Initialize() if the storage is a ResourceStorage instance.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetJsonSerializerSettings
member.summary: Internal for test purposes.
member.returns: JsonSerializerSettings

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetTypeSchema(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the type schema definition for the specified .NET type name, used by the report designer for metadata and validation. Returns a JSON representation of the type's structure including properties, methods, and other metadata.
member.param: The fully qualified or simple name of the .NET type to get schema information for.
member.returns: A JSON response containing the type schema definition, or BadRequest if the type name is null or empty.
member.remarks: This endpoint is called by the Web Report Designer client to understand .NET types during design-time operations.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetTypeSchemas(System.String[])
member.summary: Retrieves type schema definitions for multiple .NET type names in a single request, used for bulk metadata queries by the report designer. Returns a JSON array containing the schema information for each requested type.
member.param: Array of .NET type names to retrieve schema information for.
member.returns: A JSON array containing the serialized type schema definitions for each requested type name.
member.remarks: This endpoint optimizes performance by allowing the Web Report Designer client to fetch multiple type schemas in a single HTTP request instead of making individual calls to GetTypeSchema.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetDefaultComponent(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a default instance of the specified report component type and returns its serialized property values. Used by the report designer to initialize new components with their default configuration.
member.param: The name of the report component type to create (e.g., "TextBox", "Table").
member.returns: A JSON response containing the serialized default properties of the component, or a minimal JSON object with just the NetType property if the component cannot be created.
member.remarks: If the component type cannot be created, returns a minimal JSON object containing only the NetType property.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.ListFonts
member.summary: Retrieves all font names registered and available for use in the report designer environment. Returns a JSON response containing the font list or an error message if fonts cannot be accessed.
member.returns: A JSON response with HTTP 200 containing the available fonts, or HTTP 404 with error details if the font system cannot be accessed.
member.remarks: Returns HTTP 404 with error details if the font system cannot be accessed or initialized.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.PaperSizes
member.summary: Retrieves all supported paper sizes with their dimensions for use in report page configuration. Returns a JSON array containing paper kind names and their corresponding width and height values.
member.returns: A JSON array containing objects with paperKind, width, and height properties for each supported paper size.
member.remarks: Paper sizes are predefined constants from the Telerik.Reporting.Drawing namespace and always return successfully.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.CultureContext
member.summary: Returns culture-specific context properties (such as decimal separator and unit type) for report serialization and designer localization. Provides consistent formatting information used across the designer interface.
member.remarks: Always uses InvariantCulture to ensure consistent serialization behavior regardless of server locale settings.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetExpressionBuilderHierarchy
member.summary: Returns culture-specific context properties (such as decimal separator and unit type) for report serialization and designer localization. Provides consistent formatting information used across the designer interface.
member.returns: A JSON object containing decimalSeparator, listSeparator, and defaultUnitType properties for consistent formatting across the designer.
member.remarks: Always uses InvariantCulture to ensure consistent serialization behavior regardless of server locale settings.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetExpressionBuilderParametersHierarchy(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the hierarchy of available parameters for the report expression builder, based on the provided parameter values. Creates a parameter category containing both parameter values and labels for use in expression construction.
member.param: The raw parameter data from the request body containing parameter names.
member.returns: A JSON response containing a Category object with parameter value and label items organized for expression building.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetWizardStyleSheets(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of predefined design-time stylesheets for the specified report item type. Provides style presets that can be applied to Table and Crosstab components during report design.
member.param: The design-time item type name (e.g., "Table", "Crosstab").
member.returns: A JSON response containing serialized stylesheet definitions for supported types, or null content for unsupported types.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetDesignerResource(System.String,System.String)

The resource file name.
member.returns: Returns the report designer resource.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetComponentBindingPaths
member.summary: Returns the available binding paths for a report component, enabling data binding configuration in the designer. Analyzes the component's properties to provide bindable paths for expressions and data connections.
member.returns: A JSON response containing an array of binding path strings that represent the bindable properties of the specified report component.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetReportDocument(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts binary report definition data into a structured report document object for processing and manipulation.
member.param: The unique identifier of the report definition, used to determine the format (package vs XML).
The binary data containing the serialized report definition in either package or XML format.
member.returns: An IReportDocument instance representing the deserialized report structure ready for processing or modification.
member.remarks: Delegates to ReportManager which automatically detects whether the definition is a packaged report (.trdp) or XML format and applies the appropriate deserialization logic.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetReportBytes(System.String,Telerik.Reporting.IReportDocument)
member.summary: Converts a structured report document object back into binary format for storage or transmission.
member.param: The unique identifier of the report definition, used to determine the output format (package vs XML).
The IReportDocument instance containing the report structure to be serialized.
member.returns: A byte array containing the serialized report definition in the appropriate format based on the definition ID.
member.remarks: Delegates to ReportManager which automatically determines the output format based on the definition ID and applies package or XML serialization accordingly.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.CreateSharedDataSourceResolver

member.remarks: Analyzes data source specified by and to generate field schema information. Supports nested field structures for complex object navigation. Used by the report designer to provide field selection UI and data binding configuration for various data source types. Includes enhanced JSON serialization settings to handle complex object references and prevent circular reference issues during serialization.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.InternalServerError(System.Exception)
member.summary: Logs exception details to the trace output for diagnostic purposes when an internal server error occurs.
member.param: The exception that caused the internal server error, containing the error message and stack trace information for debugging.
member.remarks: Records both exception message and full stack trace using for server-side error tracking. This method provides logging functionality but does not return an HTTP response - it's used in conjunction with other error handling methods.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetReport(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the report definition from the root folder.
member.param: The report identifier.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetReportAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a report definition by its URI from the report storage, returning the report content in JSON format.
member.param: The unique resource identifier (URI) of the report definition to retrieve. Must be a valid report URI within the report storage.
member.returns: A JSON content response containing the report definition on success, HTTP 404 (Not Found) if the report URI does not exist, HTTP 400 (Bad Request) for validation errors, or HTTP 400 for other failure conditions.
member.remarks: Asynchronously loads the report definition from storage using the provided URI and returns it as JSON content. Used by the report designer to load existing reports for editing and preview purposes.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.ReportExistsAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether a report definition exists at the specified URI location in the report storage.
member.param: The unique resource identifier (URI) of the report definition to check for existence. Must be a valid report URI within the report storage.
member.returns: HTTP 204 (No Content) response if the report exists at the specified URI, HTTP 404 (Not Found) if the report does not exist, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) for validation errors or other failure conditions.
member.remarks: Uses the same report retrieval mechanism as GetReportAsync but returns only existence status without content. Used by the report designer to validate report availability before performing operations that require existing reports.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.SaveReportAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new report or updates an existing report.
member.param: The report identifier.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.SaveReportByUriAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new report or updates an existing report definition by saving the JSON report content from the request body to the specified URI location.
member.param: The unique resource identifier (URI) where the report definition should be saved. Must be a valid report URI within the report storage, including the file extension.
member.returns: HTTP 200 (OK) response on successful save operation, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) with error details if validation fails, URI is invalid, or the report definition cannot be processed.
member.remarks: Reads JSON report definition from the request body, validates and deserializes it, then saves to storage at the specified URI location. Supports both creating new reports and updating existing ones, with automatic validation of report content and URI format.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.DownloadReport(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads a report definition from the root folder.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.DownloadReportAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads a report definition file as binary content from the specified URI location in the report storage.
member.param: The unique resource identifier (URI) of the report definition file to download. Must be a valid report URI within the report storage.
member.returns: A file download response containing the report definition as binary content with "application/octet-stream" content-type and original filename, HTTP 404 (Not Found) if the report does not exist, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) for other failure conditions.
member.remarks: Retrieves the raw binary data from storage and returns it as a downloadable file with appropriate headers for client-side file saving. Used by the report designer to export report definitions as files for backup, sharing, or external editing purposes.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.UploadReportAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Uploads a report definition file from multipart form data to the specified URI location in the report storage.
member.param: The unique resource identifier (URI) where the report file should be saved. If not provided, uses the uploaded filename in the root folder. Must be a valid report URI within the report storage.
member.returns: HTTP 200 (OK) response on successful upload, HTTP 409 (Conflict) if a report already exists at the specified URI, HTTP 400 (Bad Request) for validation errors, or HTTP 400 for other failure conditions.
member.remarks: Reads report file from the first file in the multipart form data, validates the report content, and saves to storage at the specified URI. Prevents overwriting existing reports and includes automatic validation of both URI format and report file content before storage.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.DeleteReport(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a report from the root folder.
member.param: The report identifier.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.DeleteReportAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a report definition by its URI from the report storage.
member.param: The unique resource identifier (URI) of the report definition to delete. Must be a valid report URI within the report storage.
member.returns: HTTP 200 (OK) response on successful deletion, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) for validation errors or other failure conditions.
member.remarks: Permanently removes the report definition from storage and cannot be undone once completed. Used by the report designer to delete unwanted reports and free up storage space.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.RenameReportAsync(Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Models.RenameResourceModel)
member.summary: Renames a report definition by changing its name while preserving its location and content within the report storage.
member.param: The model containing the rename operation data, including the current report URI and the new report name with extension.
member.returns: A JSON response containing the of the renamed report with updated URI, filename, and metadata, HTTP 404 (Not Found) if the report does not exist, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) for validation errors, duplicate names, or invalid report names.
member.remarks: Renames report at to while maintaining content and folder location. Returns specific error codes for duplicate names, invalid names, and cases where the target name is the same as the current name.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetReportsInFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the contents of a report folder, including all report definitions and subfolders within the specified folder URI.
member.param: The unique resource identifier (URI) of the report folder whose contents should be retrieved. Use null or empty string for the root folder.
member.returns: A JSON response containing a with separate collections of report files and subfolders, HTTP 404 (Not Found) if the folder does not exist, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) for validation errors.
member.remarks: Returns organized folder contents with report definitions in the Files collection and subfolders in the Folders collection for navigation. Supports hierarchical folder structure navigation and provides file metadata including full path information for each report.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.CreateReportsFolder(Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Models.CreateFolderModel)
member.summary: Creates a new report folder with the specified name within the designated parent folder location in the report storage.
member.param: The model containing the folder creation data, including the folder name and optional parent folder URI location within the report storage.
member.returns: A JSON response with HTTP 201 (Created) status containing the of the newly created report folder, including its generated URI, name, and hierarchy information.
member.remarks: Creates report folder at with name (root folder if ParentUri is null). Returns HTTP 404 if parent folder not found, HTTP 400 for validation errors, duplicate folder names, or invalid folder names.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.GetReportsFolderModel(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the folder model containing metadata and properties for the specified report folder.
member.param: The unique resource identifier (URI) of the report folder. Use null or empty string for the root folder. Must be a valid folder URI within the report storage.
member.returns: A JSON response containing the with folder metadata, including name, parent URI, and subfolder information, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) for validation errors or invalid URIs.
member.remarks: Returns folder metadata including , , and properties for navigation and hierarchy display. Used by the report designer to display folder properties and support hierarchical folder navigation within the report storage.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.DeleteReportsFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Permanently deletes the specified report folder and all of its contents, including subfolders and report definitions.
member.param: The unique resource identifier (URI) of the report folder to delete. Must be a valid folder URI within the report storage.
member.returns: HTTP 204 (No Content) response on successful deletion, indicating the folder and its contents have been permanently removed, HTTP 404 (Not Found) if the folder does not exist, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) for validation errors or conflicts with other storage locations.
member.remarks: Irreversible operation that removes the folder and all nested content, with safety checks to prevent deletion of folders used by other storage systems. Includes validation through EnsureUriIsNotUsedByOtherFileStorages to prevent conflicts with SharedDataSource and resource storage root directories.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Controllers.ReportDesignerControllerBase.RenameReportsFolder(Telerik.WebReportDesigner.Services.Models.RenameFolderModel)
member.summary: Renames a report folder and updates its URI while preserving all contents, including subfolders and report definitions.
member.param: The model containing the rename operation data, including the current folder URI and the new folder name within the report storage.
member.returns: A JSON response containing the of the renamed folder with updated URI, name, and hierarchy information, HTTP 404 (Not Found) if the folder does not exist, or HTTP 400 (Bad Request) for validation errors, duplicate names, or invalid folder names.
member.remarks: Renames report folder at to while maintaining all folder contents and nested structure. Returns specific error codes for duplicate folder names, invalid names, and cases where the target name is the same as the current name.

The fallback resolver should kick in when rendering reports whose resources were resolved using the definition storage path, i.e. our PopulationDensity demo where the world.shp is referenced as \Resources\world.shp Since the main resolver uses the \Resources folder as its base dir, the \Resources path gets duplicated, so the main resolver fails and the fallback resolver succeeds.
